alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 8:24AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Rapid small river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain combined with heavy rain last night will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Caribou, Portage, Washburn, Ashland, Woodland, Portage Lake, Madawaska Lake, Nashville Plantation, New Sweden, Connor, Castle Hill, Perham, Wade, Stockholm and Westmanland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
